page.title: 20Dorchester Show
page.content: This show is held annually in early {September.}It started in 1840 and has taken place in{Came Park}for several years. Approximately 25000 people went in 1984, so it is presumed that a similar number will attend in 1985. It is mainly an agricultural show which local farmers and the general public attend for both business and pleasure. There are classes in which fatstock animals are shown and judged; exhibitions of the latest equipment; and a horticultural section containing miniature gardens, flowers, shrubs and prize vegetables. There are also rural arts and craft stalls but one of the main attractions is the showjumping. It costs Â£2.50 for an adult to visit the show and Â£2.00 for a child or a pensioner. There are some reductions after 3.00pm.
